knowledge_transfers: Devlog Posting Enforcement Protocol: All agents must post devlogs after every significant task/assignment completion with mandatory 'Next Steps' section at end, skimmable format, MASTER_TASK_LOG references, posted to agent-specific Discord channels using devlog_poster_agent_channel.py
Devlog Compliance Status: 6/8 agents (75%) have accepted coordination - Agent-2, Agent-3, Agent-4 (Captain enforcement loop), Agent-5, Agent-7, Agent-8. Agent-1 pending acceptance.

Build-In-Public Deployment Verification: Phase 0 sections NOT visible on live sites (dadudekc.com, weareswarm.online) - deployment execution required (Agent-3 coordinating, blocker: server access credentials)
Coordination Throttling: A2A coordination messages rate-limited (30-minute minimum interval) - use A2C for acknowledgments when throttled

lessons_learned: Devlog enforcement requires protocol + monitoring + Captain authority: Protocol defines standards, monitoring tracks compliance, Captain escalates non-compliance
Deployment verification is critical: Code and copy ready doesn't mean deployed - always verify live sites to close deployment loops
Coordination throttling impacts A2A messages: Use A2C for acknowledgments when rate-limited, queue coordination messages for later delivery
Agent-7 already compliant: Some agents (Agent-7) already posting devlogs with Next Steps sections - recognize existing compliance
